title: GitHub Mermaid Diagrams Reference 2025
body:
# GitHub Mermaid Diagrams Reference (2025)

Concise, GitHub renderer-aligned Mermaid syntax & features cheat sheet with dark-friendly styling notes.

## Core Diagram Types
- Flowchart: `flowchart TD` or `flowchart LR`
- Sequence: `sequenceDiagram`
- Class: `classDiagram`
- State: `stateDiagram-v2`
- ER: `erDiagram`
- Gantt: `gantt`
- Pie: `pie title`
- Journey: `journey`

## Flowchart Essentials
```
flowchart TD
  A[Start] --> B{Decision}
  B -->|Yes| C[Path 1]
  B -->|No| D[Path 2]
  C --> E((End))
  D --> E
```
Shapes: `[Text]` rectangle, `(Text)` round, `((Text))` circle, `{Text}` diamond, `[(Text)]` subroutine, `>Text]` lean-right, `[[Text]]` hexagon.
Edges: `-->` solid, `---` line, `-.->` dashed, `==>` thick, labels with `|Label|`.

## Sequence Highlights
Participants implicit; activate/deactivate optional.
```
sequenceDiagram
  autonumber
  participant UI
  participant API
  UI->>API: GET /items
  API-->>UI: 200 JSON
  alt Empty
    UI->>UI: Render empty state
  else Items
    UI->>UI: Render list
  end
```
Notes: `Note over UI,API: text`.

## Class Diagram Snippet
```
classDiagram
  class User {
    +string id
    +string name
    +login()
  }
  class Session {
    +string token
    +Date expiresAt
  }
  User --> Session : creates >
```
Visibility: `+` public, `-` private, `#` protected, `~` package.

## State Diagram v2
```
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Idle
  Idle --> Active : event/start
  state Active {
    [*] --> Working
    Working --> Paused : event/pause
  }
  Active --> [*] : event/stop
```

## ER Diagram Primitive
```
erDiagram
  USER ||--o{ ORDER : places
  ORDER ||--|{ LINE_ITEM : contains
  USER ||--o{ ADDRESS : uses
```
Crow's foot: `||` mandatory one, `o{` zero or many, `|{` one or many.

## Gantt Minimal
```
gantt
dateFormat  YYYY-MM-DD
title Release Plan
section Core
Dev    :a1, 2025-09-01, 7d
Test   :after a1, 4d
Release:milestone, 2025-09-15, 0d
```

## Styling (GitHub)
- No `theme` override; GitHub auto-selects light/dark.
- Prefer accessible colors: rely on default palette for text/lines.
- Avoid `style` blocks with fixed light-only colors.
- Use subgraphs to group logically: `subgraph Group A` ... `end`.

## Accessibility & Readability
- Keep node labels <= 3 words if possible.
- Use sentence case; avoid shouting caps.
- Provide alt-text in surrounding markdown.

## Performance Tips
- Limit large graphs (<150 nodes) for GitHub rendering reliability.
- Split complex flows into multiple diagrams referencing each other.

## Validation Checklist
- Renders both light & dark (no hardcoded color conflicts)
- No orphan nodes
- Edges labeled where decision branches diverge
- Consistent directional layout (favor TD or LR, not mixed)

Use this as a quick authoring accelerator for consistent diagrams in documentation and design discussions.
